New Records: Fakhar Zaman scored Pakistan's fastest-ever World Cup century off 63 balls.
New Zealand made their highest score ever in a World Cup with 401 runs.
Shaheen Afridi bowled the most expensive spell in Pakistan's World Cup history with figures of 10-0-90-0.
Haris Rauf bowled the second most expensive spell in Pakistan's World Cup history with figures of 10-0-85-1.
Key Match Events: Fakhar Zaman scored an unbeaten 126 off 81 balls, including eight fours and eleven sixes.
Rachin Ravindra scored his third century of the tournament with 108 runs.
Kane Williamson scored 95 runs from 79 balls.
New Zealand's innings included a 180-run partnership between Rachin Ravindra and Kane Williamson.
New Zealand posted a total of 401 runs.
Pakistan won the match by 21 runs via the DLS method.
Rain interrupted play multiple times, affecting the match outcome.
Pakistan's chase was adjusted to 342 runs from 41 overs due to rain.
Fakhar Zaman was named player of the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and chose to bowl first.
Post-Match Reflections: Babar Azam expressed belief in their batting and the importance of building partnerships.
Kane Williamson acknowledged the difficulty of the result despite New Zealand's high total and praised Pakistan's performance.
Fakhar Zaman highlighted the aggressive mindset and team meetings focusing on scoring more runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain affected the match, leading to multiple interruptions and adjustments to the target.
The match was played in Bengalaru with rain impacting the game conditions.
